newsitem.title: ITALY: Berlusconi says repeated welfare offer to Prodi.
newsitem.headline: Berlusconi says repeated welfare offer to Prodi.

text.p: Italian opposition leader Silvio Berlusconi held talks with Prime Minister Romano Prodi on Friday in which he repeated his offer of a deal on welfare reform to boost Italy's EMU entry hopes.
Berlusconi, a former prime minister, told reporters that during the 90-minute meeting with Prodi he reiterated an offer made on Thursday in a letter to the leftist newspaper L'Unita.

In the letter, Berlusconi proposed striking "a transparent compromise" with the government and establishing an "understanding for Europe" to help meet EMU entry criteria while reforming Italy's welfare state.
"I have already clarified my position in the article in L'Unita. That is my position and that is what I repeated this morning to the prime minister," he said.
"Now it is up to Prodi to respond," Berlusconi added.
Prodi's office said the talks were "cordial".
